alert.note: Alert for San Luis Obispo; Santa Barbara (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 24 at 8:57PM PST until February 26 at 8:00AM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM PST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of San Luis Obispo and Santa Barbara Counties. * WHEN...Until 1100 PM PST. * IMPACTS...Heavy rainfall could trigger shallow debris flows in and near recent wildfire burn scars. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected, including along creeks and small streams and some roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 850 PM PST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. This is causing urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Santa Maria, San Luis Obispo, Lompoc, Pismo Beach, Arroyo Grande, Nipomo, Vandenberg Air Force Base, Orcutt, Cuyama, Grover Beach, Guadalupe, Highway 166 between Twitchell Dam and the Cuyama Valley, Lake Lopez, Black Mountain, Carrizo Plain, Oceano, Highway 101 over Cuesta Grade, Shell Beach, Ventucopa and Highway 33 from Lockwood Valley Road to the Santa Barbara County line. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Move away from recently burned areas. The rain will likely trigger shallow mud and debris flows, minor rock falls, and flooding capable of localized damage, especially in steep terrain in and near burn scars. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
